result.execSummary:
The defendant James D Hamlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James D Hamlin

defendant.name: Hamlin, James D
defendant.address: 4400 LaSalle St Lot 47, Eau Claire, WI 54703

records.addlTxt: Time to Pay Summary mailed to defendant

9:51 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James D Hamlin in court without counsel. 
State recites the agreement. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to count 1: Disorderly Conduct. Court accepts plea finds the defendant guilty and orders court costs, DNA sample and applicable surcharges. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with.

Case called at 11:45 AM. 
Defendant James D Hamlin in court without counsel. Attorney Monica Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  State requests the Defendant be released on his own recognizance; Court so orders; No bond set.
Defendant ordered to provide fingerprints today.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 6/6/22 at 3:00 PM.
RTN: 6/28/22 at 9:30 AM.
Hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
